channel.title: Best Web Developing Software
channel.description:
What would you consider the best web developing software? Preferably not WYSIWYG, because that only adds RAM/CPU taken up.
I'm sick of DW and it's shittiness.
Some features I'm looking for: Syntax highlighting. Tag hinting. Nested code completion. Optimized for HTML, PHP, JS, CSS. Site mapping. FTP auto-upload on save. Automatically apply doctypes and such.

item.title: Best Web Developing Software
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

I love Notepad for the simplicity and how easy it is too work with, but i never realised how powerfull Dreamweaver is.

Id have to say theres nothing better than Dreamweaver

Read full topic

item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

welshy:

php designer 2007

I already got that, but it is mostly just code highlighting and coloration. the FTP thing in it only downloads not uploads(it seems) we want an auto uploader on save.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Web Developing Software
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

kloplop321:

let me guess you have a duo core processor. Well an application(unless it has been specially programmed) can only run on one processor, that’s why it is taking up 50% because it is hogging 1 whole out of your 2. so literally it is taking up 100% on that 1 processor of your double.

TBH, I don’t know hardly anything about my computer. It was giving to me for free, so I didn’t ask any questions I know it is decently old though. I’m happy with it though (mostly). The hard drive that came with it is 152GB, which is more than enough for me The only problem I’m having right now is that I can’t download anything over 5MB. It says it’s downloading but it gets to a certain point and stops, continuing to say it’s downloading though.

Anyways, I got off-topic. Sorry about that xD

Read full topic

item.title: Best Web Developing Software
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

let me guess you have a duo core processor. Well an application(unless it has been specially programmed) can only run on one processor, that’s why it is taking up 50% because it is hogging 1 whole out of your 2. so literally it is taking up 100% on that 1 processor of your double.

sorry If I word things weird.

And I multi-task, intensively, and If Dw is going to take 1 whole of my processors, I’ll just suspend it when I don’t use it. I am using Process explorer by Systernals or something. It is like a super version of the task manager.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Web Developing Software
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

kloplop321:

it is good, but seriously, what is wrong with it and the processor!

I have no problem running Dreamweaver on my computer, but I just looked at the processor and was wowed… It is less than firefox, but for some reason takes up 50% of my computer’s use… Strange…

Read full topic

item.title: Best Web Developing Software
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:4, topic:144324”][quote author=h44ckzor pwnage link=topic=197882.msg1764128#msg1764128 date=1190084685]
You could try Notepad++?
[/quote]

What I found unattractive about npp is that it is designed for general programming. In web developing, I’d like it to follow Doug McIlroy’s Unix philosophy: “Write programs that do one thing and do it well.”

WYSUWYGless editors are hard to come by, but you can usually disable that function. Before I got DW I used…http://www.nvu.com
The only thing Notepad++ has is syntax highlighting -.-

Nvu looks really shitty. Just uninstalled it. And npp has more stuff than syntax highlighting, though you’d have to add your api list.[/quote]
I haven’t used it in a while, and guess what, I installed on Ubuntu here, and just ran a sudo apt-get remove on it. I agree 100%, it is shitty -.- Maybe that’s why I finally downloaded a Dreamweaver ISO…

Read full topic

item.title: Best Web Developing Software
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

h44ckzor pwnage:

You could try Notepad++?

What I found unattractive about npp is that it is designed for general programming. In web developing, I’d like it to follow Doug McIlroy’s Unix philosophy: “Write programs that do one thing and do it well.”

[quote=“Exception, post:3, topic:144324”]WYSUWYGless editors are hard to come by, but you can usually disable that function. Before I got DW I used…http://www.nvu.com
The only thing Notepad++ has is syntax highlighting -.-[/quote]

Nvu looks really shitty. Just uninstalled it. And npp has more stuff than syntax highlighting, though you’d have to add your api list.

Read full topic
